CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: Christos Rozakis;Elisabeth Steiner;Giorgio Malinverni;Loukis Loucaides;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , a taxi driver , had driven PERSON and PERSON to their destination . According to PERSON , an argument broke out between him and the applicant upon arrival at the destination and the applicant injured him with her car . According to the applicant , PERSON assaulted her and attempted to break the car door and windscreen . She denied that she had injured him and claimed that he had been in good health when she had left .

CARDINAL . On DATE the NORP Town Court of LOC convicted the applicant of reckless driving resulting in an injury and sentenced her to DATE imprisonment conditional on DATE probation . The court based its findings on the version of events presented by PERSON and rejected statements by witnesses PERSON , PERSON . and PERSON , who had supported the applicant 's version of events .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a statement of appeal . She contended , in particular , that the court had not been impartial as it had based its findings only on the contradictory statements of PERSON and PERSON , and had disregarded her version which was supported by many witnesses ' statements .
CARDINAL . According to the ORG , both the applicant and her lawyer were informed of the appeal hearing . The ORG submitted the following documents :
( a ) a copy of the summons of DATE which was addressed to the applicant , the victim , counsel for the applicant and for the victim and to the prosecutor ;
( b ) an extract from the registry correspondence log , indicating the dispatch of the summons to the applicant 's home address ;
( c ) an extract from the court delivery log , indicating that the summons had been delivered to the advocates ' office of which counsel for the applicant was a member .
CARDINAL . The applicant submitted that she had never received the summons . As regards her counsel , the summons had indeed been received by CARDINAL of his colleagues but not by him personally .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG examined the case on appeal . The court heard submissions by the judge rapporteur and prosecutor , who asked the court to reject the appeal . Neither the applicant nor her counsel was present at the hearing . ORG upheld the judgment of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant asked ORG to grant her access to the case file . She submitted that on DATE a judge of ORG had refused the request on the ground that the conviction had become final , but she did not provide any documentary evidence in support of this .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of LAW ( “ the LAW ” ) provides an appeal court examines appeals with a view to verifying the lawfulness , validity and fairness of judgments .

CARDINAL . Under LAW of the LAW , parties to the proceedings shall be notified of the date , time and place of an appeal hearing DATE beforehand . LAW provides that the parties ' failure to appear before the court , if they were duly informed of the date and time of the appeal hearing , is not an obstacle to the examination of the case .
CARDINAL . Under LAW and QUANTITY , an appeal court can directly examine evidence , including additional material submitted by parties .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Code sets out the grounds for setting aside judgments . In particular , a judgment will be quashed if there is an inconsistency between the conclusions reached by the court in the judgment and the facts established . Article CARDINAL provides that such an inconsistency will occur if , inter alia , the court 's conclusions are not supported by the evidence examined in the hearing ; if the court fails to take into consideration circumstances which could substantially affect its findings ; or if , in case of contradictory evidence , the judgment does not specify why some of it is accepted and the remainder is rejected .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provides that , summonses and copies of procedural documents shall be sent by registered mail with an acknowledgement of receipt form .
